Settings.Name: Custom Archetypes
Settings.Description: Unlock 4 custom AI archetypes ('My Archetype' 1-4) that you can configure with custom behavior patterns. These are player-defined archetypes for specialized builds or unique playstyles not covered by the 13 built-in archetypes.
Settings.Tooltip: Adds: Target Allies > Custom Archetypes spell container with 4 customizable AI profiles

Settings.Name: Mind Control Spells
Settings.Description: Grant access to mind control spells that let you directly command NPC allies and controlled creatures. Useful for temporarily taking control of dominated enemies or charmed NPCs during combat.
Settings.Tooltip: Adds: Target Allies > Mindcontrol Orders spell for NPC/dominated creature control

Settings.Name: Swarm Tactics (Experimental)
Settings.Description: Enable swarm AI for controlling large groups of summoned creatures or minions. ‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING: Swarm AI uses simplified behavior and may not be as smart as individual companion AI. Best for summoners with multiple creatures.
Settings.Tooltip: Adds: Swarm Group control spells for mass summon management (limited AI capabilities)

Settings.Name: Disable Dash Action
Settings.Description: Prevent AI allies from using the Dash action to move extra distance. Enable this if your allies are wasting turns dashing instead of fighting, or if you prefer they conserve actions for attacks and spells.
Settings.Tooltip: Removes: AI ability to use Dash, Longstrider, and similar movement-boosting actions

Settings.Name: Disable Throwing Weapons
Settings.Description: Stop AI allies from throwing weapons, potions, or grenades. Useful if your allies are wasting valuable thrown items or if you want to manually control all throwing actions.
Settings.Tooltip: Removes: AI ability to use Throw, Tavern Brawler throws, and Berserker throwing abilities

Settings.Name: Smart Spell Slot Conservation
Settings.Description: AI dynamically blocks high-level spell slots based on ally health. At full health (99%+), blocks all spell slots. As health decreases, gradually unlocks higher spell slots: 90%=1st, 80%=2nd, 70%=3rd, 60%=4th, 50%=5th, 40%=6th. Prevents spell slot waste in easy fights.
Settings.Tooltip: Recommended for tactician difficulty and resource-conscious gameplay

Settings.Name: Bonus Action Orders
Settings.Description: Change Focus/Ignore target spells to cost a bonus action instead of a full action. Makes tactical target prioritization faster but uses your bonus action slot. Good for combat flow but conflicts with other bonus actions.
Settings.Tooltip: Changes: Focus/Ignore spells become bonus actions with modified mechanics

Settings.Name: Tactical Formations
Settings.Description: Enable formation-based positioning system. AI allies automatically arrange themselves based on their role. Use the dropdown below to select which formation your allies should use.
Settings.Tooltip: Toggle on to activate formation positioning for your allies

Settings.Name: Formation Type
Settings.Description: Choose how your allies position themselves in combat. Frontline: aggressive melee positioning. Midline: balanced support positioning. Backline: safe ranged positioning. Scattered: spread out to avoid AoE.
Settings.Tooltip: Only active when Tactical Formations is enabled

Settings.Name: Auto-Heal Response
Settings.Description: AI healers automatically prioritize healing when any ally drops below 50% HP. Overrides normal AI behavior to ensure survival. Healer archetypes will interrupt their actions to cast healing spells when this threshold is reached.
Settings.Tooltip: Recommended for keeping your party alive in difficult encounters

Settings.Name: Aggression Control
Settings.Description: Enable AI aggression stance controls. Use the dropdown below to set how aggressively your allies engage enemies.
Settings.Tooltip: Toggle on to activate aggression control for your allies

Settings.Name: Aggression Mode
Settings.Description: Choose your allies' combat stance. Aggressive: focus on damage and finishing enemies. Defensive: prioritize survivability and crowd control. Support: focus on buffing allies and utility.
Settings.Tooltip: Only active when Aggression Control is enabled

Settings.Name: Debug Spell Panel
Settings.Description: Add debug and testing spells to the 'AI Allies: Extra Spells' container. Includes diagnostic tools for troubleshooting AI behavior, status inspection, and archetype testing. Only enable if you're debugging issues or developing custom content.
Settings.Tooltip: For mod developers and troubleshooting only - not recommended for normal gameplay
